metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0489 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
APT before 1.0.9, when the Acquire::GzipIndexes option is enabled, does not validate checksums, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted package.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0489` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apt - 1.0.1ubuntu2.3
apt-transport-https - 1.0.1ubuntu2.3
apt-utils - 1.0.1ubuntu2.3
libapt-inst1.5 - 1.0.1ubuntu2.3
libapt-pkg4.12 - 1.0.1ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1ubuntu2.3').
